website_summaries.verdict: A pricey but useful adapter for anyone who wants to use a MacBook but see the results on a much bigger screen.
pros: Adds two USB 3.0 ports and a 4K-capable HDMI port via USB-C
cons: There's no SD card slot and it's kind of pricey
The device's USB-C port can't transfer data and can only be used for charging

customer_reviews.title: Really Good, but Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: I love the slim, minimalist design of this adapter, but I wish the portion of the cord was a few inches longer. If you have your laptop on a stand, the adapter hangs out the port and seems to interfere with the connectivity. I realized upon the first use it was designed really for use with a laptop sitting flat on the desk, but again, a few more inches would thrilled me. Also the connector seems to be a little touchy, I constantly have to jiggle it to ensure the connection is good.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Works, mostly
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my 2017 HP x360. I do notice that it sometimes gets hot, and sometimes it doesn't seem to want to initialize all the ports properly, though most of the time it works. I am using power delivery passthrough and a USB to HDMI adapter to drive an additional monitor and when it works, it's great, but I sometimes have to unplug the incoming power USB-C connector and replug for it to turn on the USB to HDMI monitor and deliver power through to my laptop. I'd give an additional 1 star each if those issues weren't there.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Use it with to connect a 12" macbook to a monitor. I especially liked the pass through charging which lets me charge the laptop as it is connected to the monitor. Worked well for the first couple of months and then started the endless flickering of the screen - flashing between a working display to black(no connection). This would go on for hours making the connector unusable. Tried switching out HDMI cables which did not help. Looks like a loose connection and I don't want to do too much rejigging so it does not damage the laptop's single port.
customer_reviews.author: raom

customer_reviews.title: Fizzled out and eventually died a year later
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 11/2/18 and worked great for about 6 months, then for the last 6 months worked sporadically, and finally as of 11/2/19 it doesn't work at all. Completely useless one year to the day later! Can't recommend since it should have lasted much, much longer. When it did work, it was exactly what I wanted and needed!
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: Great design, horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Really bad quality. Product arrived fine and worked really well for the first few months, but it started getting loose at the connector and the monitor image would shake and stutter. Unit got progressively worse until no image would display anymore regardless of jiggling the connector.
customer_reviews.author: Scipio

customer_reviews.title: and large monitor to the V20 and use it like a mini PC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to use with my LG V20 mobile phone. The goal was to be able to book a keyboard, mouse, and large monitor to the V20 and use it like a mini PC. This device does that all fine, however, it will not charge the V20 as fast as the power is drawn while the HDMI port is attached to a monitor. This is why I gave the device 4 stars instead of 5. In all fairness, the problem may be with the phone and not this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect for my 2019 MPB 13"
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for my use case. I use it to extend a single monitor, charge my 2019 MBP 13", and my iPhone. I don't see it breaking anytime soon unless you bump the thunderbolt port. Since I use this on a desk vs. my lap I don't see this happening. It's slim enough that it slides in the exterior pocket of my MBP sleeve without notice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goo

customer_reviews.title: It works, but have some trouble using more than 3 ports on 2 adapters at once
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my new Macbook Pro. Unfortunately, if i load up one and then add one USB to another, one USB will not want to work. Idk if its just the total power from the computer's USBCs don't want to process so much, or if it has to do with the Adapter here. Sorry, not a wiz at this, but hopefully someone who is will find this information useful. (For reference, I have plugged in to one: the charger (USBC), a small Cintiq (USB), a wireless keyboard (USB, Logitech product). I occasionally plug in a second adapter either to plug in a printer or a USB stick, and I usually have to unplug one of the other USB wires)
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: works fine. power is great
customer_reviews.text: works fine. power is great. however that very very very short cable connection to the laptop is a serious issue. think hard about the config on your desk before buying. I need to add here. Someone asked a question about problems getting their Mac external keyboard to connect. I had the same problems. There's something about that keyboard. I got an Apple cable just for that. It works fine, always, no problems. The Satechi works for my Logitech and my Xerox printer. For some reason it didn't like the keyboard. Don't know why.
customer_reviews.author: L. Polin

customer_reviews.title: if it is in good working condition I will change this review
customer_reviews.text: Update: I am changing this to 5 stars because of the amazing customer support that Satechi offers. I emailed them with my issue and they responded within 3 minutes, and after a couple quick emails they are mailing me a replacement right away. Awesome customer support!! ---- The adapter worked for a few days and then seemed that it died. It no longer passes data or power through. I have requested a replacement and when I receive it, if it is in good working condition I will change this review. When the hub worked, it worked great. It looks and feels high quality.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: A must for Macs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a new MBP, hoping to provide some backwards compatibility to connect older USB devices. Works great for that purpose and for connecting MBP to a projector. Have found several times where I had wished I would have bought a model that included a memory card reader or LAN port. If I had to buy a new one, I'd probably get a dongle with more functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact adapter for MacBook Pro 2016
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm for my 2016 MacBook Pro. Size: Compact. Not much wider and only twice the length than the USB only dongle that Apple sells. It's an easy choice to carry only this and be able to hook up multiple USBs, HDMI out, and power. Functionality: To test the dongle, I completed a Time Machine backup connecting my Seagate external hard drive via USB 3 to the dongle while simultaneously charging my laptop through the dongle as well. Both worked like a charm - and I (appeared) to get USB 3 speeds. I also tested the HDMI out and got 1080p resolution on my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: item arrived with problems, most noticeably with my usb speakers. When connected to the hub the sound cuts in and out like there's a short and even when i'm not using the computer there's periodically a sound like it's being connected or disconnected. when the speakers are plugged directly into the computer everything is fine, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF T.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I believe I've gotten a defective port. Whenever I plug in my second monitor using an hdmi cord, the second monitor "blinks" over and over, about once every 10-20 minutes. It's not a brief flicker, it's as if someone's turning it on and off over and over and over. Unplugging it and replugging it in usually fixes it for a short time. If I switch to a different hdmi adaptor there is no flicker whatsoever, so it's not the cord or the monitor, it's the adaptor. I would love to know why this is happening.
customer_reviews.author: Eric O'connor

customer_reviews.title: Color coordinated USB- C Hub - Most Functional
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just got a new laptop for college that's rose gold, and because it's a USB C only laptop,. MOST IMPORTANT was to have the power-pass through and many of the listed USB-C adapters don't provide power pass through. This little attachment provides ports for plugging in her iPhone (USB to Lighting), HDMI for school presentations and and extra USB port for thumb drives. It matches the color perfectly and is easy and functional!. All good things for an incoming college student who has little time to worry over tech stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dilisio

customer_reviews.title: Great compact adaptor for MacBook
customer_reviews.text: Great adaptor for the new MacBooks and their new ports. Can attach USB and HDMI cables. Was able to use the HDMI port to connect to a HDTV for a business demonstration. One of the ports is powered. However, it wouldn't work with my apple external DVD/CD drive. I needed to get a separate adaptor and plug straight into the MacBook. Takes very little space.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chotimongkol

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, does what I want
customer_reviews.text: My employer just issued me a Macbook Pro. Needed an inexpensive way to attach a second monitor. This multi-port adapter does the trick. It's easy to pack too so it will be a help in having to connect to all the different projectors I come in contact with. I don't mind that there are absolutely no bells or whistles.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Schalk

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's the adapter or device, but sometimes I have issues with screenflickering when using this with my chromebook. Funny enough, it's only if I have a wireless mouse adapter plugged into this adapter and my mouse is on the secondary screen. For the most part though, this works great.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Does NOT work.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if I could. This device overloads my MacBook Pro 2017. It crashes constantly (the device), with a pop up window on my Mac saying it’s using too much power. It worked for about a week, and since then, this has been the issue. I bought it specifically for uploading photos from a usb XQD card reader and an external hard drive. I am completely unable to transfer my photo files or utilize my external hard drive via this device. Find another produce. Buying this is the same as setting $60 on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after a week. The adapter is so sensitive that you have to be holding it together at the perfect angle to get a connection. As soon as I put it down to return to typing, the connection was out again. I tested the HDMI cable with other adapters, and it was clearly this Satechi adapter that was the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it so I could use USB devices on my 2018 MacBook Pro. Had it for months now and it works perfectly. I run a keyboard, external HD and the charging cable through it.
customer_reviews.author: All Things Good

customer_reviews.title: Small, handsome, cheap and dead simple.
customer_reviews.text: Freaking great. This is the sort of thing that either works or it doesn't, a d it works beautifully for me, every day. I use it as a 'micro docking station' of sorts and plug/unplug it multiple times daily. It's also tiny, attractive and well-priced. There's nothing more I could ask or expect of it. A solid 5 stars is well deserved here. Note: I'm using it exclusively with a 5th Gen Lenovo X1 Carbon. I have not tried it with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and discovered that the USB C port on the case no longer works. The 2 USB ports are okay. I bought this for the extra USB c port. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ArtTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than similar device from Apple, yet has an additional USB port. Looks better than Apple's device, as the Space Gray color perfectly matches my laptop. When I have something plugged into all ports, it is warm to the touch, but not burning hot. I used to have 4 thick cables running to my previous MacBook; it's a joy to plug in this single hub to my laptop and immediately have monitor, keyboard, mouse and additional peripherals all up and running!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Audio does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for a while but recently the HDMI audio does NOT work. Audio keeps on skipping and you absolutely cannot hear anything when plugging your laptop into a tv. I don’t even use the hdmi plug that often, not sure how it broke. Probably only used it no more than 10 times.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Compact
customer_reviews.text: Compact and small, so very portable. Works with my 2018 MBA and USB HD's that I have used for 10 years as TM backups. It took several times to insert USB cables into the unit to get it to respond as expected, not sure if it was my problem or one from the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: M. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with new  MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a fine product but does not work with my new MacBook Pro for anything - not any of several printers, not the external disk drive - not nuthin'. The only thing that I found to work was the Apple made product. (Getting pretty fed up with Apple these days.)
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Holiman

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Port Defective After 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI port started having issues after only 2 months of minimal use. When connected the screen wavers and pixelates. It doesn't look like I have an option to return for a replacement. $60 wasted. Also not a fan of how far out from the laptop the device extends.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Shreve

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice product that works fine, but it gets HOT!
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice product that works fine, but man it gets HOT! To the point that I took a few stars off because I'm worried about safety of the electronics when it runs this hot. Still works a month in, but not sure how long it will last at these temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: sethk2

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked on and off for about a year and then quit. Can't recommend this connector: most of the time it wouldn't make a good connection, and it was very touchy when it did finally connect. Then it stopped connecting altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: So far I haven’t had problems with this hub! I really like the way it looks and having a case on my MacBook would not be a problem with this on. I don’t like have hard it is for me trying to plug it in my Mac and trying to take it off. I feel like it may be a hair width bigger for the ports. I also have noticed the fans of my Mac turning on after having it plugged in for a while. But really I do recommend trying it out and seeing what you think of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jibin Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Satechi's support however was great, and they quickly tried to help resolve the ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this product on my 2016 Macbook Pro 13", to connect to the HDMI video conferencing system at work, and the HDMI plug could not maintain a connection (would flicker on and off). Apple's version worked ok, so it's something to do with the adapter. Satechi's support however was great, and they quickly tried to help resolve the problem. I ended up not returning it as I found another use on a monitor at home, where it seems to work okay. Apparently it can be dependent on the quality of the HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: a shame
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expensive version, because I thought it would be good to have a high quality version to use long-term. I also cross referenced reviews with other online review sites. The USB C point seemingly pops out of my Macbook Pro 2018 on a regular basis, and the USB ports do not work. Unfortunately, I did not return it in time. The product is a dud. I ended up going with the low-cost cable creation version and that works great.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, but I expect it to last forever for ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as advertised on a 13" Macbook Pro 2016 with no touch bar. Decided to pay the extra cash and be sure it worked instead of buying several faulty cables while trying to save money. I've only had it for a few hours, but HDMI and USB's work while charging through, compared to other cables on Amazon that reportedly didn't. Satisfied, but I expect it to last forever for the price. Also it isn't an exact match for space grey, but it is close enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bad 🐇

customer_reviews.title: Great dock!
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid I was going to have to return my new Mac Book because of accessibility but this dock solved all my problems. It is beautiful and it works like a charm. Good job, Satechi!
customer_reviews.author: the ibu

customer_reviews.title: I was loking for this.
customer_reviews.text: This serves the purpose well. I waited a while before posting this review to make sure the product worked to its touted merit. I am happy to report this adapter for my Macbook Pro works perfectly. I use multiple ports at the same time, albeit not regularly. However, this product has not given me any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Linton S. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: 5/5, great for updated mac laptop owners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother, for a birthday present. I'm not great at knowing what to get my tech-savvy brother, so I often ask him for his wish list. He immediately asked for this Satechi Multi-Port for his new Mac. He's had it for a good month now, and it's showing no signs of wear. He loves it. It may be expensive, but it's well worth the quality as well as how sleek and nice it looks. It holds up well to his shiny Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Hana Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: While it does feel solid and well made, the USB C connector is just slightly the wrong size. This makes the connection a bit loose and unsteady. The HDMI doesn't work consistently, nor do the USB ports. Wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DougV

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty well at first
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well at first. Wouldn't output 4K at 60hz over the hdmi port but that was fine, probably had more to do with the monitor/laptop setup than anything. About a month into use it started connecting/disconnecting every 2 seconds whenever the power was plugged in, making it borderline unusable. Every once in a while it settles down and I can actually use it until the next time I plug it in. It gets pretty hot too. If I didn't have any issues with it I would give it 4-5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bryan Londeree

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and multi-task, you need this multiport adapter. Keeping the laptop charged while playing a movie through the HDMI or editing photos through a thumb drive, I'm able to do it all. The product is sleek and compact. Haven't experienced any heat issues or malfunctions. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bosley

customer_reviews.title: great and reliable adapter
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this daily for over a year on my MacBook Pro and have not had any problems. I’ve even hooked it up to a KVM switch and was successful at connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful & sturdy but one limitation
customer_reviews.text: It's good, it works, after 6 months using at work & home it still works, so much simpler than carrying tons of dongles, the HDMI works fine, the pass through charging works fine. One caveat - it can NOT charge an iPad Pro, iPad showed as connected but not charging, so you can sync & transfer files, but not charge, so that is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: lizzeymac

customer_reviews.title: I like the inclusion of two USBs which allow me to ...
customer_reviews.text: Provides more functionality than the multiport from Apple that is $49. I like the inclusion of two USBs which allow me to use my older backup hard drive as a time machine and I can use my Logitech mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Just what I needed. I charge my phone laptop and plug up to my TV easily. I love this. Worth the money! I’ve had no absolutely no problems with it. It hasn’t been faulty. Works well with my MacBook Pro(2017)
customer_reviews.author: David Ray

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with this hub - but built-in USB-C cable is too short for my liking
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried the HDMI connector yet, but the other ports work as advertised. The reason I'm only giving this product four stars is that the built-in USB-C cable is too short for my needs. If your notebook computer sits on a stand on your desk like mine does, this hub will be dangling in mid-air next to your computer - not good.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelX

customer_reviews.title: Now I can go big screen Prime.
customer_reviews.text: Without this gadget I would go nuts making the various connections. The best connection for me connects my new 13-inch MacBook Pro to my new 32-inch monitor. Now I can watch Prime movies on a big screen. Now maybe I can give Charlize Theron a kiss. I can also connect my scanner, printers (2) and a mouse (but not all at once). I only go a little nuts. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Charles P

customer_reviews.title: Quality and reliability in a great design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for a long time and I love it. I don’t use it every day but when I do it allows for great connectivity. The materials and finishes are top class, and it sure has lasted a long time in prime condition. It also came with a carrying pouch that I appreciate fully. Wish it was a bit cheaper though.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable USB C to USB adapter with pass through charging
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought one of these for my MacBookPro two years ago. My wife bought a similar product from another supplier. That quit working after a short time. So I bought another Satechi adaptor to replace her non working one. Great device works well and is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: Loving my plugadoo
customer_reviews.text: I actually got my adapter a day earlier, which was most appreciated because I'm leaving town tomorrow. Also, this adapter is DAMN good. I have a Das Keyboard with two USB-A ports but it requires two USB-A ports to power it AND additional devices. Makes sense I guess. Anyhoo, it's like having a new MacBook didn't impact my life negatively, I love this!. Passthrough charging too?! Ace.
customer_reviews.author: Spaceman Fresh

customer_reviews.title: Compactness, versatility, build.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, build quality, functions well for presentations via HDMI and as accessory plug/charging station. None of these inexpensive docks send 4K @60hz, so if you want this for a gaming rig rather than presentation/expansion, it's not for you. Used as intended, and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Has a habit of making USB keyboards not function
customer_reviews.text: I have to remove my computer from my desk often for work, and every time I do this, there's an increased risk that the device will no longer read USB ports when it's plugged back in. I've gone through 3 USB keyboards at work, which now no longer work with other computers. I'm not sure how this is happening, but I recommend you avoid this product if you at all value your USB devices.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for Late 2016 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well on my Late 2016 MacBook Pro. I have a 27" LCD monitor and a USB 2.0 hub (that has a USB audio device, externally powered WD hard drive, and a couple of data USB cables connected to it) and it generally works without issue. Occasionally the LCD monitor will show a blue screen for video, but unplugging the HDMI from the hub and reconnecting it usually resolves the issue.
customer_reviews.author: NPike

customer_reviews.title: Good, except HDMI connection requires power
customer_reviews.text: The monitor only works over the HDMI connection if the usb C power is connected to the hub. This was not clear from the description, though I don't know if this is an Apple limitation or a limitation of this specific product, as I have not used any other adapters for HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: Alphonso

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive one-port solution for a MacBook or MacBook ...
customer_reviews.text: Using with a Dell 27" QHD (2560x1440) display (with the USB running to the hub built into the Dell display). Great, inexpensive one-port solution for a MacBook or MacBook Pro. Would love it if a DisplayPort 1.2 version was available to drive a 4K display at 60Hz.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Did not connect well
customer_reviews.text: Did not work reliably. Most of the time could not get my monitor to connect top my MacBook through the HDMI plug. Gave up and bought the more expensive Apple connector.
customer_reviews.author: Wahine

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This item works very well for me. I've had it for about 6 months now and it has served me well. I regularly attach an HDMI cable and 2 USB attachments. Never had a problem with heat, plug/play, etc.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cord broke
customer_reviews.text: The cord slowly degraded over time to where there was a sort of "static" on my display. I tried three different displays. Eventually it got to the point where the display would cut out and then come back. Or I'd have to jiggle the cable around. Eventually I got mad and threw it in the trash. Lasted for 630 days though! Not bad considering some of the garbage manufactured nowadays. Used it almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: It is a defective product. When plugged into the computer, a warning popped up saying to disconnect. Did so on each computer that was tried. Other similar products worked without this problem.
customer_reviews.author: JoLez

customer_reviews.title: Holy Satechi Batman!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built hub. The housing is made of aluminum I think, which is nice, and not like others that are cheap plastic. So far has worked with everything that I have plugged into it. Would 0f been nice to have it with a SD card reader like my old plastic hub, but I can live without. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ronabong

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most cost effective Type-C docking device I could find and it works well. I connected my monitor to my MacBook 2016 which worked flawlessly. Then I got a USB-3.0 seven (7) port device which connected all my external printers, keyboard, headset, etc., and everything worked leaving another USB-3.0 connector available on this multi-port. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: c-man

customer_reviews.title: I really like this adaptor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this adaptor. Bought it over similar adaptors due to its HDMI port along with the two standard USB. Works great. Only thing is hat the unit gets hot during use. Other than that it works great. No complaints here
customer_reviews.author: allioxynfree

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these and both stopped working within a couple months of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cardinell

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter to connect old devices to the new USB-C Apple laptops!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this adapter to use with the new 2016 Apple MacBook Pro with touchpad since Apple took away all of the old inputs. I have used all the ports included in this adapter and all have functioned perfectly as expected. It is very nice to have all the connections in one adapter for old devices. The color perfectly matches the Apple laptop. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the computer will reject this adapter when it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the computer will reject this adapter when it's not connected to a power source because it pulls too much power. Otherwise, I have little to no issues with it. These hubs are expensive, but necessary while usb-c is still in its infancy.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory for new MacBook line
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my new 2016 13" Macbook Pro with Touch Bar. It has a low profile, and so far, all the USB devices that I've used work fine. And it definitely also charges the laptop while in use. It's small enough to carry in my bag until I'm able to transition to USB-C devices. It was exactly what I was looking for and it works as described.
customer_reviews.author: MileHIDi

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 45 days
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it broke. I am not happy about the return window closing.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Maloney-Scott

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: does what it's supposed to do with no fuss or muss. Wish everything could be so easy and still work.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Works great when using one thing at a time
customer_reviews.text: Works great when using one thing at a time. However, connecting both the HDMI and a mouse (wired or wireless) results in a very laggy mouse movement, scrolling, clicking. USB on its own works great, but with other things plugged in, the are very slow. Disappointing because I expected this to work flawlessly with multiple things plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I product itself is fine when functioning properly. However, after a few months it began to show problems. The HDMI would stutter and shake when connected. It would take several attempts to get it to stop doing this. Now it will not connect at all and the USB ports do not connect either. Very disappointed in the quality of this product. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: The product is excellent, The logistics through which this product was delivered ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent, The logistics through which this product was delivered is really questionable. Left on the driveway as opposed to the front door. It is a miracle that I did not step on it with my car. So a delicate product delivered in a sub-standard fashion, really questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Jose-Maria Castro

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK for a while, and then the HDMI stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally used for a few months and then suddenly the HDMI and UBS-C pass through stopped working... Expected more from such an expensive adapter
customer_reviews.author: Greg Corra

customer_reviews.title: Not a fix for HDMI glitches with the apple multi-port dongle
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine as a USB hub. However, if you were hoping this would do a better job with HDMI than Apple's multi-port dongle, then I'm sorry to report that it does not. To be perfectly fair however, I suspect that Apple will fix the HDMI glitches with a software update.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but gets hot
customer_reviews.text: Very good adapter, I hope prices are going to go down soon because that's still a lot of money for an adapter. 4 stars because it gets very warm, but I guess it would have been even more expensive otherwise so... I like the design.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like is the small cable between the adapter and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Bought my mom one too. The only thing I don't like is the small cable between the adapter and the plug, it feels unnecessary, looks inelegant. Still better than most other adapters I've used, has not failed me in the year I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I use the product for plugging devices into my MacBook Pro, because my new MacBook Pro does not have the inputs for USB cords, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Wrong

customer_reviews.title: slim and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could hook up a large monitor for my husband to his Macbook Pro. I needed a Type-C with an HDMI port. I also needed USB ports for the mousse & keyboard. This is hub is sleek, slim and works like a charm. It is easy to use and the new monitor setup made my husband very happy.
customer_reviews.author: KMac

customer_reviews.title: ... luck with similar adapters but this one has worked great for 2 years and it's still great
customer_reviews.text: I've had back luck with similar adapters but this one has worked great for 2 years and it's still great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nakajima

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and color-coordinated
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's lightweight the color nearly matches my new slate gray MacBook 12". The 2 standard USB ports are great, and the HDMI port is helpful for when I need to do a screen presentation at the office. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: DavidC

customer_reviews.title: The product came as shown. I tested all the ...
customer_reviews.text: The product came as shown. I tested all the ports except for the hdmi. It does as advertised. In hindsight, I would probably get the other one with the sd card drive and LAN connector as you never know when you could use it.
customer_reviews.author: HI808

customer_reviews.title: Quit working 2 weeks after return window closed
customer_reviews.text: Device was great and worked fine for about 90 days. HDMI ports stopped working approximately 2 weeks after my return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: PF Dover

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize my new Mac wouldn't have USB ports. I should have bought this earlier, but was so thankful for it when I found it. I love that it's Space Gray and looks like it was supposed to come with my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered adapter error
customer_reviews.text: USB-C power passthru worked for about 3 months. Plugged in today and XPS 13 is giving underpowered adapter warning. I cannot recommend this, it just doesn't last. I wish someone would make one of these that doesn't suck
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: it is not so stable. and the connection is ...
customer_reviews.text: it is not so stable. and the connection is often off when you plug more than one usb devices. and it gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Design. Fit well with my MacBook Pro 2016 ...
customer_reviews.text: Stylish Design.Fit well with my MacBook Pro 2016 space grey. (Have a slight color difference with the laptop itself, but totally acceptable.) Come with one type C, two USB 3.0 and the most important one -- HDMI port, to connect with an extended monitor or projector. All ports work well. It is a tool you need to have for MacBook Pro 2016 owners before the real Type C time comes. :)
customer_reviews.author: Yue Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Mostly
customer_reviews.text: Working well for our two 2017 Mac Book Pros. UPDATE: 6 months later one of the hubs is having connectivity issues. May need to return it for replacement. (-1 star). Other one still appears to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Building quality is great. It also shows resistance because it is aluminum. Matches perfectly with the new MacBook space gray.
customer_reviews.author: Cibelly

customer_reviews.title: The one exception is my Macbook Air Super Drive which complains about not having enough power through ...
customer_reviews.text: Most things seem to work with it on my 2016 Macbook Pro 15". The one exception is my Macbook Air Super Drive which complains about not having enough power through the Satechi hub on MacOS. The Satechi hub does work with the same drive under WIndows 10 on the same Macbook Pro using bootcamp, however. I bought ended up buying the Apple USB-C to USB adapter which does work on MacOS with the Super Drive.
customer_reviews.author: pirey4

customer_reviews.title: Great, well built expansion device that does exactly what ...
customer_reviews.text: Great, well built expansion device that does exactly what it says. With a perfect size, and durable construction, I find myself reaching for this much more so that USB-A to USB-C adapters. Very recommended for new Apple notebook users.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: So far, wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been working very well. I only have been using the USB ports and not the others so far. So, I will update my review again for more accuracy. The product came on time with no difficulties, though.
customer_reviews.author: Luckson DC

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable accessory for the MacBook Pro or other laptops with USB-C ports.
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for all our MacBook Pro users (myself included). Compact and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Maller

customer_reviews.title: Stopped reading external harddrive
customer_reviews.text: This was great for about 11 months, but then it quit working and I was panicked looking for a new external harddrive and a new cord to my external harddrive and ended up at the apple store only to realize it was the adapter the whole time. Infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this adapter. I run an external monitor, power, backup hard drive, and keyboard / mouse on a second USB hub. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Doughty

customer_reviews.title: Work okay for a bit
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine until it didn’t., Probably lasted 6 months. Better off getting one that allows you to hardwire. Orrrrr Apple certified one.
customer_reviews.author: Tun@

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Adapter is light weight
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Adapter is light weight, matches mbp excatly (space grey). Cord seems to be well contructed. I have downloaded photos through USB have not used other options. Should save carrying a birds nest of cords.
customer_reviews.author: mitch

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and compact
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It is so slim and compact, yet looks great and works like a charm. Perfect for a mobile office.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: It's absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: No issues, works as advertised, it's a bit expensive but very good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine C.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and reliable
customer_reviews.text: The product worked quite well; it delivered as promised. Without the Satechi Multi-Port adapter, the MacBook Pro was a standalone device while with the Satechi Mutil-Port adapter, we were able to attach an external monitor, a Magic Mouse and connect to our company's Ethernet network.
customer_reviews.author: DDS

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to apple's hindsight with the new small MacBooks
customer_reviews.text: My only negative for this product is that you can't use two external hard drives simultaneously :(. Not enough power. Otherwise geeat product very well made. I called for questions and they were very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: A good workaround for different USB connectors.
customer_reviews.text: A good workaround for the problem of having multiple peripherals that have older USB cable connectors than the receptacles on my new computer. It's expensive though. At least it's good to look at and seemingly rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: John Joseph Peloquin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 2017 Macbook 12". Every port works flawlessly including the HDMI. Color match is perfect as well. 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: Satechi Slim Aluminum Type-C Multi-Port Adapter with USB-C Pass-Through, 4K HDMI, USB 3.0 - Compatible with 2020 MacBook Pro, 2020 MacBook Air, 2020 iPad Pro (Gold)
product_meta.description:
Color:GoldThe Satechi Type-C Slim Aluminum Multi-Port Adapter adds a plethora of connections to your laptop or desktop, just by using one Type-C port. Add 4K HDMI, pass-through charging, and two USB Type-A ports to your computer. Available in silver, gold, rose gold, and space gray.

4K HDMI Video Output 
Use the Slim Multi-Port Adapter's 4K HDMI port to output video from your computer to a 4K monitor. If your computer supports 4K you can enjoy beautiful, crisp high-resolution displays by simply connecting an HDMI cable from your Multi-Port Adapter to a 4K monitor. The Multi-Port Adapter requires a HDMI to HDMI cable version 1.4 or higher. The external display must support a direct HDMI connection. Please note when changing video signal source, your monitor may flicker for a few seconds. Normal operation should resume within 5 seconds.

Type-C Pass-Through Port 
Don’t worry about sacrificing your Type-C port, with the included pass-through port, you can easily charge your Type-C device while using the other included outlets. Maximum power output: 60W 

Additional Expansion Ports 
With two USB Type-A ports, the Adapter has plenty of room for your additional peripherals. Not compatible with Apple SuperDrive

Compatibility
2020/2019/2018/2017/2016 MacBook Pro, 2020/2018 MacBook Air, 2020/2018 iPad Pro, 2019/2017 iMac, iMac Pro, 2015/2016/2017 MacBook, Microsoft Surface Laptop 3/Surface Pro 7/Go, Google PixelBook Go, ChromeBook, Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro S, HP Spectre Convertible, Razer Blade, Huawei Matebook and more USB-C devices.

Important Notes
USB-C pass-through charging feature supports devices with USB Power Delivery protocol 2.0 and higher
HDMI port supports only devices with DisplayPort over USB-C with Alternative mode 
Operating temperature: 86-122°F

1 Year Manufacturer Warranty
feature_bullets: EXPAND YOUR TYPE-C PORT - features two USB 3.0 ports, Type-C pass-through charging port, and 4K HDMI (30 Hz) video output

USB-C PASS-THROUGH CHARGING - quickly charge your Type-C laptop while simultaneously using other USB ports. Note: USB-C charging feature only supports devices with USB Power Delivery protocol 2.0 and higher (max power output 60W)

CRYSTAL CLEAR HDMI VIDEO - output high resolution display to your HDMI-enabled external monitor, up to 4K @ 30Hz. Note: HDMI port supports only devices with DisplayPort over USB-C with Alternative mode
SLEEK, MODERN DESIGN - brushed aluminum finish complements your Apple accessories for a timeless and modern desk set up

DESIGNED FOR TYPE-C DEVICES - 2020/2019/2018/2017/2016 MacBook Pro, 2020/2018 MacBook Air, 2020/2018 iPad Pro, 2019/2017 iMac, iMac Pro, 2015/2016/2017 MacBook, Microsoft Surface Laptop 3/Surface Pro 7/Go, Google PixelBook Go, ChromeBook, Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro S, HP Spectre Convertible, Razer Blade, Huawei Matebook and more USB-C devices
